required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Pulmonary Embolism in Pregnancy: Biomarkers and Clinical Predictive Models
clinical_study.official_title: Diagnosing Pulmonary Embolism in Pregnancy: Are Biomarkers and Clinical Prediction Models Useful?

brief_summary.textblock: Objective: To evaluate whether trimester specific d-dimer levels and brain natriuretic protein (BNP), along with the modified Wells score (MWS), is a useful risk stratification tool to exclude pregnant women at low-risk of pulmonary embolism (PE) from diagnostic imaging with radiation exposure.

detailed_description.textblock: To account for all women meeting the study eligibility criteria, this study utilized a combined prospective and retrospective arm. Pregnant women who underwent diagnostic imaging to evaluate for suspected PE at our institution were prospectively enrolled from February 2014 to August 2015. Both d-dimer and BNP serum levels were drawn, and a MWS was assigned. All pregnant women diagnosed with a PE that underwent diagnostic imaging and had a d-dimer level drawn from January 2009 to June 2014 were retrospectively enrolled. Patient electronic records were used to apply the MWS and analyze their risk.

primary_outcome.description: Trimester specific D-dimer levels to identify pregnant women at low risk for pulmonary embolism, thereby avoiding radiation exposure

secondary_outcome.measure: Modified Well's Criteria- a risk scoring system for likelihood of pulmonary embolism
secondary_outcome.description: A Modified Wells score of >4 suggests pulmonary embolism is likely and therefore diagnostic imaging needed

arm_group.description: Pregnant women who underwent diagnostic imaging to evaluate for suspected PE at our institution
Pregnant women who underwent diagnostic imaging to evaluate for suspected PE at our institution

study_pop.textblock: pregnant women who presented to the Emergency Department or Labor and Delivery unit with signs and symptoms suspicious for PE

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion criteria:
- adult pregnant women >= 18 years old
- d-dimer obtained and if the patient was pregnant at the time of PE diagnosis
- patient presented to the Emergency Department or Labor and Delivery unit
- patient presented with signs and symptoms suspicious for PE
Exclusion criteria:
- non-pregnant patients
- patients < 18 years old
